statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Santa Clara turns away Northern Colorado 87-84
article.headline: Santa Clara turns away Northern Colorado 87-84
article.linkText: Santa Clara turns away Northern Colorado 87-84
article.story: STANFORD, Calif. -- Kevin Foster scored 19 points and Ray Cowels added 18 to lead Santa Clara past Northern Colorado 87-84 on Tuesday night. Freshman Evan Roquemore added a season-best 18 points, including four free throws in the final 13 seconds, for the Broncos (4-1), who won their third straight. Neal Kingman scored a career-high 21 points to lead the Bears (2-2), who lost back-to-back games for the first time since February 2009. Devon Beitzel added 20 points, Emmanuel Addo 12 and Chris Kaba 12. The Bears drew within 77-76 on Beitzel's 3-pointer with 2:13 remaining, but Roquemore sank four free throws over the next minute to give the Broncos a cushion. Addo gave Northern Colorado a 24-23 edge with 7:31 left in the first half. Chris Cunningham responded with a pair of free throws and a layup to put Santa Clara ahead to stay. The Broncos led at halftime 46-37.
